text:
The Biden Administration's lack of a substantive trade agenda is hurting family farmers in Illinois and hindering economic opportunities.

I am working with @RepFeenstra on @WaysandMeansGOP to advocate for Midwest agriculture.
newsweek.com/bidens-trade-po…

The @WaysandMeansGOP passed my Health Savings for Families Act of 2023, legislation that would allow individuals to maintain a HSA even if the individual’s spouse is enrolled in a FSA. This will allow patients to have more choice and control of their own health care dollars.

Wasting our time on a Motion to Vacate does a disservice to the American people.

I stand with @SpeakerMcCarthy who has delivered consistent, conservative results since we took the Majority. Let’s end this sideshow and continue to work to rein in spending and secure the border.

The Biden Administration’s open border policies, supported by Governor Pritzker and Democrats throughout Illinois, have turned every town into a border community.

It’s past time that Democrats in Congress work with House Republicans to strengthen border security!

Governor Pritzker should answer the legitimate questions Illinois residents have about their taxpayer dollars going to CCP-backed companies.

The @CommitteeOnCCP is actively looking into the leveraging of federal tax dollars by CCP-backed companies to expand their footprint in the US. foxnews.com/politics/blue-st…

I opposed the Continuing Resolution today that only furthers DC’s out of control spending addiction and fails to address the crisis at our southern border. Families in #IL16 must meet a budget and it’s past time DC do the same. With over $33 Trillion in debt, Congress needs to change the way it spends or we will threaten the economic future of our kids and grandkids.

Chinese companies are circumventing tariffs at the expense of Illinois manufacturers and workers.

I joined @committeeonccp Chairman @RepGallagher to urge the Administration to take action to address this blatant trade fraud.

At @MIT and @MITLL this week, I joined @HouseIntel to hear from experts on emerging technologies. We are committed to working with leaders in the tech space as Congress and the Intelligence Committee work to address AI challenges and protect our national security.

Enjoyed visiting with Major General Henry Dixon, Deputy Commanding General of U.S. Army Central and a native of Dixon, IL. We had a good discussion about our military readiness and presence in the Middle East and Central Asia.

I am grateful for his service to Illinois and our country.

Inland waterways of IL are critical to our economic viability and allow small businesses, farmers and manufacturers to export commodities. I am proud to join bipartisan members of the IL delegation to introduce the Upper Mississippi River Levee Safety Act.farmweeknow.com/policy/natio…

The Biden Administration continues to enable a humanitarian and security crisis at our southern border.

House Republicans are fighting to strengthen our border and national security.
foxnews.com/politics/migrant…

On Friday, the Peoria Park District (PPD) honored Bonnie Noble, former Executive Director, with a portrait unveiling. Bonnie had a remarkable career with the Park District serving for over four decades and was instrumental with the establishment of the RiverPlex, the Rock Island Trail, the Golf Learning Center, the Peoria Playhouse Museum and the revitalization of the Peoria Zoo. She is missed everyday, but her legacy lives on. A big thanks PPD President Robert Johnson and Executive Director Emily Cahill.

Instead of backing cops, Governor Pritzker and Mayor Johnson have recklessly gutted law enforcement’s ability to do their jobs. Confidence among police officers in Chicago and Illinois has never been lower.

Soft-on-crime policies are failing Illinois. cbsnews.com/chicago/news/ill…

Discriminatory digital trade barriers threaten the competitiveness of small businesses and our supply chains. Passing a new GSP with updated criteria can help rebalance the scales and ensure our businesses remain strong. I discussed these pressing trade issues @WaysandMeansGOP:
Always great to visit with Josh from ABATE of Illinois! I appreciate his advocacy for Illinois bikers and I’ll continue to voice for our bikers and a safe motorcycling environment.

Rural health challenges are some of the top issues I hear about in #IL16. Flawed implementation of surprise medical billing protections by the Administration threatens access to care in rural communities. I raised questions about these challenges at our @WaysandMeansGOP hearing.

236 years ago, the framers of our nation signed the U.S. Constitution and laid the foundation of freedom and prosperity that continue to make us uniquely American. I will always defend freedom and liberty.

Happy Constitution Day!

Since joining Congress, upgrading the 182nd's fleet has been a top priority of our office. I am pleased the Air Force has appropriately recognized the 182nd leadership and I will continue to advocate for the men and women who serve our nation in Congress. lahood.house.gov/2023/9/laho…

Peoria’s 182nd Airlift Wing has been chosen by the Air Force as a preferred location to receive C-130Js! The 182nd is one of the premier C130 units and a vital part of our community. Upgrading the fleet will ensure the wing maintains its flying mission for years to come.
Proud to support the Lee-Ogle Transportation System, which greatly benefits rural communities in #IL16.  shawlocal.com/sauk-valley/20…

The biofuels industry in Illinois is vital to our state’s economy and supports our ag community. I am honored to receive @GrowthEnergy’s Fueling Growth Award for being a biofuels champion in Congress and advocating for Illinois’ leading industry.

Great to visit with Ritch Fundell, a trucker from Tonica, during @TRUCKINGdotORG’s National Truck Driver Appreciation Week in DC. For 25 years and 1.5 million accident-free miles, Ritch has committed himself to safe trucking.

Truckers keep our economy moving in #IL16 and I appreciate all they do for our communities.

It was incredibly moving to be in Lower Manhattan this morning at the 9/11 Memorial and Museum to remember the lives lost 22 years ago.

We will never forget.

Today, we pause to remember the thousands of lives lost in the terrorist attacks on 9/11/01. 

We will never forget the events of that day, the brave men and women who saved lives, and the resilience of the American spirit in the face of pure evil. #NeverForget911

Thanks to Dunlap Fire Chief Jim Hanson for meeting this week to update us on his Department, including work to upgrade and improve their facilities. I appreciate all the work Dunlap Fire, their crew, and volunteers do to keep our community safe.

Congratulations to @EnerconPower in the Peoria area for 48 years in business! 

Enercon is family run and a leader in engineering and power solutions. I was honored to join them to celebrate this milestone and recognize their continued commitment to central Illinois.

I visited @OSFHealthCare this morning for a hard hat tour of the Cancer Institute in Peoria. The new Cancer Institute will make OSF in Peoria a hub for cancer research & treatment, supporting patients from across the state & country. Thank you to State Rep. Ryan Spain, former Peoria Mayor Jim Ardis, and Ryan Luginbuhl for hosting us. I appreciate OSF’s hard work to serve the community and #BringHopeHome.

I visited the new Precision Planting facility in Morton today, which opens in the fall. This new location will bring hundreds of jobs to the area while supporting Illinois agriculture, the #1 industry in our state. I appreciate all of the innovative work Precision Planting does to support Illinois farmers!

Collins Aerospace is defining and innovating the future of flight and travel. Thank you to the @CollinsAero Team for showing us their facility in Winnebago County yesterday. We had a robust discussion about the future of aerospace and the leading role Illinois can take.

Thank you to Sauk Valley Community College President Dr. David Hellmich for hosting us recently. We had a great discussion about workforce development programs and helping the next generation thrive in our communities in central and northwestern Illinois.
Happy Labor Day to all of the hardworking Illinoisans and Americans who continue to keep our communities strong! 🇺🇸

This afternoon, I visited the Lee-Ogle Transportation System to tour their facility and learn more about their bus system. Our office has been proud to support a Community Funding Project to bolster future growth and the construction of a new transportation facility.

China continues to threaten American manufacturers. I joined @RepGallagher and @CongressmanRaja in Stoughton, WI for a @CommitteeonCCP roundtable on the CCP’s predatory trade tactics.

Thank you to David Rashid and Dan Billie of @PlewsEdelmann in Dixon for joining us.

Started my day off in Dixon speaking to the Lee County Farm Bureau! We had a good discussion about crop yields, biofuels, trade, and input costs. As Congress negotiates the upcoming Farm Bill reauthorization, I want to ensure that our ag producers have a seat at the table.

Reauthorizing the Farm Bill is vital to protecting our family farmers and rural Illinois.

As Congress negotiates the Farm Bill, I am working to ensure our ag community in #IL16 has a seat at the table.

Read my column for @shawlocalnews:
shawlocal.com/bureau-county-…

Kristen and I will be keeping Leader @SteveScalise and his family in our prayers. Steve is a fighter and I know that he will take on cancer with the same spirit and strength as he has in previous challenges.
We live in the greatest country on earth because of men and women like Corporal Dean A. Preston, whose service during World War II we must never forget.  wcbu.org/local-news/2023-08-…

Thanks to Crusader Community Health in Rockford for hosting us on a recent visit. Crusader Community Health continues to provide essential health services in Winnebago County and I appreciate all they do to support the community and expand access to care.
Kristen and I are sending our prayers and condolences to @RepRobinKelly and her family on the passing of her husband. May Dr. Horn Rest in Peace.

In Chillicothe this morning, I met with city officials about the work being done to improve the Chillicothe Viaduct. Improving and expanding the viaduct underpass will provide better safety on the road and generate greater economic development opportunities.

Today marks two years since the Biden Admin’s catastrophic withdrawal from Afghanistan, leading to the death of 13 American service members. 

As we remember those who lost their lives, Congress must continue to seek accountability from the Biden Admin for this avoidable disaster.

The Chinese Communist Party is working everyday to undermine America’s economic and national security. 

On the @CommitteeOnCCP, @CongressmanRaja & I are working to bolster US competitiveness, strengthen our alliances in the Indo-Pacific, and address malign activities by the CCP.
I recently joined @FoxIllinois’s Beyond the Podium series to discuss threats from China, the SAFE-T Act, and the importance of agriculture for #IL16. newschannel20.com/news/beyon…

Thanks to everyone who came out to the Open House for our new Normal Constituent Service Office. Providing high quality constituent services is a top priority of mine, and the new office in McLean County will be an important resource for the community. pantagraph.com/news/local/vi…

On Purple Heart Day we honor those who have been wounded or killed while protecting our nation. Thank you to our Purple Heart recipients for your sacrifice and dedication to protecting America. It's because of these men and women that we live in the greatest country on earth.

Thanks to everyone who came out in Normal yesterday to celebrate the opening of our new office! The #IL16 Normal Office will provide McLean County and central Illinois with a key resource to get help with the federal government and support our outreach efforts.

I had a great meeting with Downs Mayor Mike James to discuss the future of the village and economic development in the community. My office was proud to help secure Community Project Funding to support the new Streetscape project in Downs!

I had a great visit at EDP Renewables in Bloomington this afternoon to discuss their wind and solar energy projects in #IL16. Wind and solar energy are critical to our economy in central and northern Illinois, and I appreciate their investment in McLean County.

Thanks to the Bloomington-Normal Water Reclamation District for providing me an update on their wastewater consolidation treatment services. As we navigate the Appropriations process, I will work to ensure #IL16 has the resources needed to provide necessary wastewater treatment.

Thank you to Mayor John Bearrows and City of Rochelle officials for meeting with me yesterday! We discussed challenges the city is facing, such as water reclamation, railroad and transload services. Great to be in Rochelle!

I met with the Ogle County Board this afternoon to discuss issues facing the county, including rural broadband and how it effects schools, agribusiness and the local economy.

I remain committed to working with the Ogle County Board to help close the digital divide and support our region in Washington.

Thank you to Etnyre for hosting us at their facility in Oregon! Etnyre is a family-owned business that serves the asphalt road construction industry, benefiting communities throughout our region. 

I appreciate all they do to generate jobs and economic opportunities in #IL16.

The CCP continues to threaten American intellectual property and the privacy of our citizens. 

At our @CommitteeonCCP hearing this week, we discussed critical and emerging technologies, such as AI, semiconductors, renewable energy, and critical minerals.

The CCP continues to exert undue influence at the UN, within other multinational organizations & in developing countries around the globe. My bill will better equip the US to counter the CCP & strengthen our diplomatic leadership at the UN & throughout the world. lahood.house.gov/2023/7/laho…

Thanks to everyone who joined us yesterday to officially open our Morris office with State Senator Tom Bennett! The #IL16 Morris Office will provide Grundy County and east-central Illinois with a key resource to get help with the federal government and support our outreach efforts.

As the leading soybean producing state in the country, Illinois is home to the best soybean farmers around. I visited @ILSoybean in Bloomington this afternoon to discuss the upcoming harvest, Farm Bill priorities, and expanding markets for our producers. 

Thanks for having me!

In LaSalle County on Saturday, I stopped by Star Union Spirits in Peru. Thanks to Jeff Yosowitz for the tour! Established in 2016, Jeff and Bob Windy have championed success in creating specialty craft spirts with their small-batch distillery. Wishing them continued success!

I spoke at the Young America’s Foundation’s High School Conference at Reagan’s Boyhood Home in Dixon about Reagan’s legacy of leadership. Thanks to @ScottWalker & @yaf for all they’ve done to preserve Reagan’s Boyhood Home & prepare the next generation of conservative leaders.

We had a productive meeting today with @ilcorn about the Next Generation Fuels Act, the upcoming Farm Bill, and preparing future farmers of Illinois. 

#IL16 is home to some of the most fertile farmland on earth, and I am proud to represent our farmers in Congress.

I spoke at the @WilsonCenterMEP program on Building Lebanon’s Sovereignty and the State. Lebanon has the potential for success, but only if the gov’t works for the people. As co-chair of the US-Lebanon Friendship Caucus, I will continue to work to strengthen the US-Lebanon relationship.

Israel is one of America’s strongest allies in the Middle East and we share an unbreakable bond.

I look forward to welcoming Israeli President @Isaac_Herzog to the Capitol today for a Joint Meeting of Congress and reaffirming our strong partnership. 🇺🇸🇮🇱
The Illinois Supreme Court’s ruling is misguided, it will harm Illinois law enforcement, and make our state less safe. abc7chicago.com/illinois-sup…

Under Governor JB Pritzker, Illinois has become less safe and violent crime is on the rise. Instead of giving law enforcement the tools they need to go after criminals, Pritzker’s soft-on-crime policies, like ending cash bail, hinder cops from keeping communities safe.

This bill makes certain that our military personnel are prepared with the resources, equipment, and support at home they need. It is a privilege to continue supporting our brave men and women protecting and defending freedom.
lahood.house.gov/news?id=D68…

The FY24 NDAA will make America safer, give our men and women in uniform the resources they need and deserve, and send a clear message to our adversaries around the globe. As we face growing threats, Congress must invest in our Armed Forces and strengthen our national security.

The Chinese Communist Party presents increasing threats to American businesses. At our @committeeonccp hearing last night, I discussed risks posed by the CCP and how we can strengthen American business presence abroad.

#IL16 is one of the largest ag producing districts in the country. I visited with the @ILFarmBureau during their visit to DC to discuss the 2023 Farm Bill, enhancement of crop insurance, biofuels, and trade. 

Thanks for stopping by!

As China, Russia, Iran, and other bad actors work to undermine America, it’s critical that Congress work to strengthen our security.

Passage of the bipartisan FY24 IAA out of @HouseIntel today is an important step to ensuring that the IC has the tools to defend the US.
Thanks to @SenDeWitte33 and @IDOT_Illinois Secretary Omer Osman for stopping by during their trip to DC!

National headlines, fueled by a massive embezzlement scandal in Mississippi, have drawn increased scrutiny about TANF - leaving people to ask: Where is all the welfare money going?

Follow our @WaysandMeansGOP Work and Welfare hearing on improving TANF: piped.video/watch?v=IofL8ywQ…

FDA approval of treatment targeting the early stages of Alzheimer’s and broader CMS coverage is an important step in the fight to end Alzheimer’s.

I will continue to advocate for policies that enhance innovation of cures, ensure robust access to care, and support caregivers. lahood.house.gov/2023/6/laho…

I stopped in Schiller Park to visit the US Ambulances for Ukraine Warehouse, which includes vehicles donated by @OSFHealthCare. The generosity of @AmbulancesU and organizations throughout Illinois continues to provide lifesaving support to Ukrainians fighting for their freedom.

Thanks to Chris Manson and the UA Resistance Foundation for showing us around!

Happy Independence Day! Today we celebrate our country, the greatest in the world, and the values that our founders put forth on July 4, 1776 - liberty and freedom.

I hope everyone throughout Illinois has a blessed and safe 4th!
Joining @PaulLisnek on WGN-TV at 9:00 AM CT for the Sunday Political Report to discuss a busy week in Washington, Russia and Ukraine, Supreme Court decisions, and more. Tune in @WGNNews.

I had a great roundtable with the Jo Daviess County Farm Bureau! Our farmers in northwestern Illinois help feed and fuel our communities and state. On the Ways and Means Committee, I will continue to advocate for the needs of farmers and support the ag industry in #IL16.
Quick stop at the Trolly Depot Coffee & Tea Co. in Galena for some coffee! ☕️

I started my day in Jo Daviess County visiting the Galena ARC to tour their facilities! For over 50 years, they have served the community, supporting early education, childcare, arts, and recreation for families and children. 

Thank you to Dave Decker and Brenda Jakel for the tour!

President Biden’s student loan bailout scheme was unfair and unconstitutional from the start. The Supreme Court was right to strike this down and reaffirm the separation of powers. This decision is a win for taxpayers, our economy, and the Constitution.

In Elmwood, we announced federal funding and unveiled plans for the new Elmwood Rural Health and Wellness Center with Graham Medical Group and the YMCA. My office was proud to help secure Community Project Funding for the center, which will support better health outcomes and physical activity in our rural communities.

Enjoyed spending some time with the Winnebago/Boone County Farm Bureau this week to hear about their priorities for the upcoming Farm Bill. Whether it’s E-15 year-round, crop insurance, labor issues, or trade policy, I will continue to advocate for our ag community in #IL16.

Supporting the economic and national security of the United States against discriminatory digital trade policies should remain a priority.

I led 46 bipartisan colleagues to urge the Biden Administration to increase engagement with the EU on changes to these policies.

Excited to partner with State Senator Tom Bennett to open a district office in Morris. The #IL16 constituent service office in Grundy County will provide east-central Illinois residents with a resource to receive assistance with the federal government and support our community engagement.

I visited the Rockford Park District to discuss the equestrian facility they are building that will support mental health therapy for kids. I appreciate the work the Rockford Park District does to support youth and physical activity. Thank you to Jay Sandine and Jennifer Bowman for hosting us!

Thank you to Hildebrandt Farms in South Beloit for showing me around their farm today! Dairy farmers are vital to the economy in northern Illinois. As we work on the upcoming Farm Bill, I will continue to advocate for our ag community in #IL16.

Great to visit Kaney Aerospace in Rockford to learn more about their operations. Jeff and the Kaney Team do a remarkable job designing and manufacturing aeronautics products to support the commercial and defense aircraft industry.

I appreciate all they do in Winnebago County!

This afternoon, I was in Roscoe to visit with village officials to discuss plans for the Main Street Corridor economic development and other priorities. Thanks to Village President Carol Gustafson, Village Administrator Scott Sanders, and Village Trustee Mike Wright for hosting us.

This morning, I attended a Naturalization Ceremony in Rockford for over 300 new American citizens who took the Oath of Allegiance to the United States. Many patriotic individuals who worked hard to legally become citizens of the United States. 🇺🇸

Thank you to McHenry County Board Chairman Michael Buehler and McHenry County Administrator Peter Austin for meeting with me today. We had a good discussion about economic development opportunities in McHenry County and ways the federal government can continue to help strengthen the community.

Enjoyed visiting with Andy Sea and students from Reservoir Gifted Academy in Washington and Bureau Valley Junior High in Manlius during their trip to DC!

Always great to see students from #IL16! They have bright futures ahead.

Yesterday, we released @WaysandMeansGOP testimony from IRS whistleblowers alleging serious misconduct and interference by Biden's IRS and DOJ in the Biden tax case. No constituent of mine would get this soft treatment. @HouseGOP will conduct rigorous oversight of the IRS and DOJ.
Joining @IngrahamAngle on @FoxNews tonight to discuss our @WaysandMeansGOP oversight and release of whistleblower transcripts that allege serious interference by Biden’s IRS and DOJ.

The EPA’s decision today to reduce blending requirements for conventional biofuels under the RFS will undermine ethanol producers in #IL16.
 
We should be expanding market access for higher blends like E15. Unfortunately, the Biden Admin’s decision will harm our ag community and biofuels producers in Illinois.

Enjoyed visiting with the Illinois Electric Cooperatives’ Youth Tour. These outstanding high school students from across Illinois won the opportunity to represent their co-op, school, and community in DC. 

They have incredibly bright futures ahead!

Today's @HouseIntel hearing with Special Counsel John Durham underscored the essential work Congress and our HPSCI 702 Working Group must do to codify clear guardrails that prevent future FBI abuses and protect the civil liberties of Americans. lahood.house.gov/2023/6/laho…

On Juneteenth, we commemorate the end of slavery in America. A pivotal moment in our history, which was made possible by courageous leaders like Abraham Lincoln who signed the Emancipation Proclamation. It allows us to reflect on our founding ideals of liberty & freedom for all.

Being a dad is the greatest privilege of my life. On Father’s Day, I am thankful for my Dad and my three sons, McKay, Lucas, and Teddy.

Happy Father’s Day to all the incredible dads in central and northwestern Illinois!
On Flag Day, we salute the American flag, the greatest symbol of freedom in the world. 🇺🇸

At my recent Ag Advisory Committee meeting, I heard from farmers, producers, and small businesses about the need to strengthen our economic competitiveness and invest in our Midwest workforce. 

Yesterday, @WaysandMeansGOP passed three bills to provide tax relief, strengthen small businesses, counter China, and support workers.

Today, @WaysandMeansGOP took an important step to reassert Congress’s constitutional duty to regulate trade. As the United States and Taiwan deepen economic engagement, the bill requires that Congress be consulted on and approve any future trade steps with Taiwan.

Nuclear energy is a key economic driver in #IL16 and an important emission-free energy resource. I toured the Byron Nuclear Plant this week to see their operation firsthand and discuss the importance of nuclear energy solutions. 

In Congress, I will continue to support an all-of-the-above energy approach that prioritizes our Midwest resources.

In Rockford this morning, I toured the the Rock River Valley Blood Center. The RRVBC provides critical blood services to patients in need throughout northwestern Illinois. Blood donations can help save lives, and I am grateful for all the work RRVBC does in the community.

Started the day in Rochelle touring the CHS Ethanol facility. We had a good discussion about making E15 permanent year-round and labor issues. On the Ways & Means Committee and in Farm Bill negotiations, I will continue to advocate for Illinois farmers and ethanol producers.

Handling classified information comes with a distinct responsibility to safeguard our national security and intelligence.

At our @HouseIntel hearing this week, I highlighted my bill to implement stronger enforcement measures for mishandling classified information.

Today, we recognize the 79th Anniversary of D-Day. 

The bravery and sacrifice of the soldiers who landed on the beaches of Normandy will never be forgotten. 

We are forever indebted to those who served in defense of our nation’s freedom. 🇺🇸

It’s inspiring to see so many young men & women in #IL16 who are willing to serve our country. I am privileged to nominate young leaders for admission into one of the military academies. This weekend, we celebrated some of those nominees who have been accepted to academies. 🇺🇸

Thanks to BCDI for presenting me with their Hero Award in Peoria this weekend. In Congress, I proudly supported legislation like the Hemophilia Skilled Nursing Facilities Access Act, which helped improve access to care in skilled nursing facilities like BCDI.

I appreciate all BCDI does to provide quality health care access in central Illinois and for their work in the community!

Egregious FISA abuses by the FBI underscore the need for Congress to reform Section 702 to better protect the civil liberties of Americans.

I joined @greta to discuss our reform efforts on the @HouseIntel 702 Working Group.

Ag is the #1 industry in Illinois. I hosted our first #IL16 Ag Advisory Committee meeting to hear from farmers and the ag community about issues impacting them. As Congress works on the Farm Bill, trade policy, and biofuels issues, I will continue to engage on our ag community in the 16th District.

Good to join my friend @JeanneIves on The Real Story to talk about my vote on the debt ceiling deal and our work in Congress. We must do more to rein in out of control Washington spending. @BreakthroughId1 piped.video/Quo_yePvsFg

Had a great visit at the new Amazon Fulfillment Center in Pekin today. They just hit their millionth package delivered in only 100 days of being open. The fulfillment center has been a strong economic force in the #IL16 and I appreciate the work they do to support the community.

FISA and Section 702 are vital national security tools, but Americans have lost faith because of egregious abuses by the FBI and IC.

On @HouseIntel, our Section 702 Working Group is looking at serious reforms to protect the civil liberties of Americans. washingtonexaminer.com/news/…

This morning I spoke to a great crowd at the East Peoria Chamber’s Eggs & Issues breakfast! I appreciate all the work the EP Chamber does in the community to support small businesses. Small businesses strengthen our communities and I will continue to advocate for pro growth policies that allow them to thrive.

Thank you to Chamber President Rick Swan and East Peoria Mayor John Kahl!

Great to be in Rockford to open our new office in Winnebago County with State Senator Dave Syverson! The #IL16 Constituent Service Office will provide northern Illinois with a key resource to get help with the federal government and support our outreach efforts. 

Thanks to everyone who came out!

Thank you to @MarquisEnergy for hosting us this week for a visit at the Hennepin plant. Ethanol and biofuels are key economic drivers for our region and I will continue to advocate for the RFS and increased market access for biofuels.

It’s great to be back in Peoria to speak with the Peoria North Rotary today! I provided a Washington update and discussed our work in Congress to strengthen the economy and put a check on the Biden Administration. 

Thanks for having me! #PeoriaRN

Biofuels are vital for rural communities and corn growers in Illinois. Brazil’s discriminatory tariffs on American ethanol will harm farmers, ethanol producers, and the economy. 

That’s why I led a bipartisan effort to urge USTR to address Brazil’s unfair trade practices.

Chicago saw the deadliest Memorial Day Weekend in seven years.

Soft-on-crime policies from Governor Pritzker and Mayor Johnson are harming our state and ruining a great city.

Support cops. Prosecute criminals. Restore the rule of law. End the madness. nbcchicago.com/news/local/ch…

Had a great visit and tour at Carle Eureka Hospital this morning! We had a good discussion about issues they are facing and nursing shortages. Carle Eureka Hospital is vital to the surrounding area, particularly our rural and underserved communities, and I appreciate their work.

I started my day at the Illinois Cancer Care facility in Peoria, visiting with staff and touring the facility. Illinois Cancer Care serves over 20,000 patients each year and I am grateful for their important work to care for individuals with cancer.

In Chillicothe, we joined Mayor Hughes, AMVETS Post 77, VFW Post 4999, the local Legion, and the community to honor those who made the ultimate sacrifice defending our country.

Memorial Day is an important reminder that freedom is not free. Thank you to the brave men and women who have served our great nation. 🇺🇸

On Memorial Day, we honor the brave servicemen and women who paid the ultimate sacrifice defending our country and our freedom.

We are forever grateful for their service and sacrifice.

Congratulations to our son Lucas on his HS graduation from Peoria Notre Dame!!  We are proud of you and the young man you have become. Thanks to all the teachers, coaches, and faculty at PND for a tremendous education and experience. Dream Big, Luke!!

The Supreme Court’s unanimous ruling on the Biden Admin’s WOTUS rule is a win for Illinois farmers, the ag community, and landowners. President Biden’s regulatory overreach has harmed Illinois, and this decision is a step in the right direction.foxnews.com/politics/supreme…

Thanks to Mike Wiesahan, owner of Lippmann’s Furniture in Peoria, for stopping by during his visit to DC. I appreciate Mike and all the small businesses that continue to generate jobs and economic opportunities in central Illinois.

I voted today to pass the HALT Fentanyl Act. 

The influx of fentanyl into our country is fueling addiction, harming communities, and killing Americans.

This bill supports law enforcement and gives them the tools they need to curb the fentanyl crisis.

Thanks to the Affordable Housing Tax Credit Coalition and the Housing Advisory Group for having me speak on the importance of affordable rental housing for economic development. 

My bipartisan Affordable Housing Credit Improvement Act would create thousands of homes in Illinois & nearly 2M nationwide.

It was pleasure to meet with Chad Hoefle, Fire Chief for the Stillman Fire Protection District, and other members of the Illinois Fire Chief’s Assoc. I am grateful to all our fire chiefs, fire fighters, and first responders in the 16th District who continue to serve our region.

We live in the greatest country in the world because of the men and women who fought for our freedom.

I was honored to welcome veterans of WWII, the Vietnam war, and the Korean War on the Greater Peoria Honor Flight to Washington, DC.

Thank you for your service! 🇺🇸

On Armed Forces Day, we honor the military members who defend our freedoms at home and abroad.

Thank you to every military member who has answered the call to service for our country. 🇺🇸

We live in the greatest country in the world because of men and women like Corporal Desilets and we will forever be grateful for his service and sacrifice. I want to thank his mom, Brenda, his family, the USPS, and entire Elmwood community for joining us today.

Corporal Desilets was awarded a Purple Heart, Navy, and Marine Corps Achievement Medal with Combat Distinguishing Device, Combat Action Ribbon, Good Conduct Medal, National Defense Medal, Iraq Campaign Medal, Global War on Terrorism Expeditionary Medal, and Sea Service Deployment Medal.

Corporal Desilets served two tours in Iraq. On May 22, 2007, 21-year-old Corporal Desilets was driving the lead vehicle returning from a mission in the dark of the night where he was killed by an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) in the Al Anbar province of Iraq.

Today, we joined the Elmwood community to honor the life of Marine Corporal Benjamin Desilets, who was killed serving our country in Iraq. Renaming the Elmwood Post Office is a small but important gesture that serves as a humble reminder of his service in defense of our freedom.

Egregious FISA abuses by the FBI underscore the need for Congress to reform 702 to better protect the civil liberties of Americans. Our @HouseIntel 702 Working Group will continue to work towards reform that ensures these types of abuses never happen again.wsj.com/articles/fbi-imprope…

It was great to see so many students from #IL16 participate in this year’s Congressional Art Competition. I hosted our annual Art Competition Reception in Rockford recently to recognize these incredible students. Congratulations to all of our award recipients, particularly to the winner Brooklyn Smith from IVC and her winning piece 'Love Bears.’

Joining my colleagues on the @committeeonccp for a hearing on “Leveling the Playing Field: How to Counter the Chinese Communist Party’s Economic Aggression.”

Tune in: piped.video/live/VI8ArYsA3Vs…

Pleased to announce that I have partnered with State Sen. Dave Syverson to open a new constituent services office in Rockford. The office will provide NW Illinois residents an important resource to navigate the federal gov’t & support our outreach efforts: lahood.house.gov/2023/5/laho…

Affordable housing remains a serious challenge for Illinois families. 

That’s why I introduced bipartisan legislation with @RepDelBene, @SenToddYoung, and @SenatorCantwell to create thousands of more affordable homes in Illinois and nearly 2M nationwide. lahood.house.gov/2023/5/laho…

As I outlined at our @WaysandMeansGOP hearing with the IRS Commissioner, Americans don't want the IRS to control the tax process from start to finish. The IRS should prioritize customer service and tax return processing: piped.video/dXw8KILDQVs

As a former DOJ prosecutor, the findings in the Durham report are disturbing. Durham’s report confirms that the FBI repeatedly disregarded critical protections that safeguard Americans from unlawful surveillance. 

Accountability and reform is needed at the FBI.

Enjoyed visiting Construction on the Mall today! I stopped by to see the folks from @JohnDeere and learn about some of their American-made construction equipment. I appreciate all John Deere does to support jobs, economic opportunity, agriculture, and construction in Illinois.

I met with Daniel Mennenoh and Mary Schuster, professionals in land title and property insurance from Galena. We discussed housing issues in northwestern Illinois, rural broadband access in the region, and protecting property rights. 

Thanks for stopping by!

During National Police Week, and on National Peace Officer Memorial Day, we honor the brave men and women who protect our communities, especially those who have lost their lives in the line of duty.

Thank you for keeping us safe. We are grateful for your service. #BackTheBlue

The Pontiac FFA in Livingston County is helping shape and educate the next generation of Illinois farmers and ag producers. Yesterday, I visited with students in the program and checked in on the incredible work they do in agriculture.

Thanks for having me!
Happy Mother's Day! I am especially grateful today for my wife Kristen and my own Mom for being incredible mothers.

I voted for the Secure the Border Act.

The Biden Admin has failed to address the crisis at our border and their open border policies threaten our national security.

Our bill will stop the flow of illicit fentanyl and illegal immigration across the southern border.

Joining @thehill this afternoon for an important discussion on expanding access to Alzheimer's care and treatment.

President Biden and DHS Secretary Mayorkas have failed to address the crisis at our southern border and they have no plan with Title 42 ending this week.

@HouseGOP will take action this week to pass the Secure the Border Act. newsnationnow.com/us-news/im…

I recently joined a bipartisan @HouseIntel delegation to visit Israel, Jordan, and Egypt to underscore our vital intelligence work with partners in the Middle East. We discussed shared priorities and how we can strengthen our national security interests.

I had a great visit with Lisa Washington, a small business owner from Rockton, Illinois. Small businesses are the backbone of our communities in #IL16, and I enjoyed hearing about her business Taylor + Max and discussing how Congress can continue to support small businesses.

Trucking shortages continue to be a persistent challenge for small businesses in Illinois. My bipartisan LICENSE Act will help streamline the process to obtain a commercial driver’s license and reduce unnecessary red tape, strengthening our economy. ttnews.com/articles/house-cd…

My prayers are with the victims and the families of those involved in the horrible crash on I-55 today in Sangamon and Montgomery Counties. We are grateful to the first responders and Illinois State Police who acted to support those in need. abcnews.go.com/US/multiple-p…

Started my Saturday in Ogle County at Brian Duncan’s farm to do some planting! The ag community is an economic driver for #IL16 and our region. I appreciate all the family farmers like Brian who feed and fuel Illinois and teach the next generation of Illinois farmers.

On @HouseIntel, we are working to reform FISA and Section 702 to better protect the civil liberties of Americans.

Intel Chair @RepMikeTurner and I released the following statement on ODNI’s annual statistical transparency report on national security surveillance authorities.
Enjoyed visiting with the Scholastic Bowl Team from Streator High School! They are in DC representing central Illinois in the WorldQuest National Competition. Good luck and go Bulldogs!

Americans don't want the IRS to control the tax process from start to finish, yet they are laying the groundwork to be both the tax preparer & auditor. At today's @WaysandMeansGOP hearing, I pressed the IRS Commissioner on their e-file plans & the importance of customer service.

Today, I voted to limit spending, save taxpayer money, and grow the economy while responsibly raising the debt limit.

It is past time for President Biden and Senate Democrats to come to the negotiating table to restore fiscal sanity in Washington.

Toured Wyffels Hybrids yesterday, a family owned seed company focused on corn and based in Geneseo! Since the 1940s, Wyffels has supported agricultural in Illinois. #IL16 is one of the largest ag districts in the country and I will continue to be a voice for farmers in Congress.

At the @CNHIndustrial facility in Goodfield today, I toured their plant and visited with workers. CNH continues to generate jobs and economic opportunities in central Illinois. I appreciated the visit and discussion on pro-growth policies that can strengthen manufacturing jobs.

The leak of sensitive, classified documents is unacceptable and it undermines our security and our allies.

@HouseIntel will work to get answers on this leak and prevent it from happening again. We must ensure that our national security is not further damaged.

Great to visit with @iltrucking during their visit to DC. Truckers are vital to our economy and local commerce in central Illinois communities. Proud to advocate for Illinois Truckers in Congress as a supporter of the DRIVE-Safe Act and apprenticeship programs.

Handling classified information comes with a distinct responsibility to safeguard our national security.

It's clear there must be reform and my bill with @RepMikeQuigley will implement stronger enforcement measures for mishandling classified information.

China continues to abide by a different set of rules and standards in the global economy. At our @WaysandMeansGOP hearing on trade and China, I highlighted the importance of American leadership on trade as a tool to strengthen our economic competitiveness.

Addressing malign economic activity by China requires strong trade policy and American leadership. 

Joining my @WaysandMeansGOP colleagues for an important Trade Subcommittee hearing on Countering China’s Trade and Investment Agenda.

Today marks 100 days of our @HouseGOP majority. We are delivering on our #CommitmentToAmerica, fighting for economy that's strong, a government that's accountable, and a future that's built on freedom.

I introduced legislation with @RepMikeQuigley to strengthen penalties and enforcement and better safeguard our national security. cbsnews.com/news/classified-…

His veto of a bipartisan resolution to overturn the unnecessary rule will further harm ag producers and sends the wrong message to Illinois farmers.agri-pulse.com/articles/1920…

Happy Easter! Wishing all who celebrate a blessed and happy day!

"He is not here, He is risen."
To everyone recognizing Good Friday, I hope you have a blessed and peaceful day of reflection.
Happy Passover to everyone celebrating! Chag Sameach!

On Gold Star Spouses Day, we recognize the incredible military families of servicemembers who paid the ultimate sacrifice serving our country. We will forever be grateful for their sacrifice and must continue to honor their legacy.

Today, I joined the Illinois Congressional delegation to request a disaster declaration for Boone County and other counties impacted by recent tornadoes and storms. This will help counties and residents clean up and rebuild amid this large-scale damage. I will continue to monitor relief efforts in Boone County.

I am praying for those involved in the roof collapse at the Apollo Theater in Belvidere and Boone County tonight. Thank you to the first responders on scene working to support those in need. I will continue to monitor the situation closely.
Much of #IL16 is under a tornado watch today, with severe weather expected and dangerous situations possible. Be prepared, be aware, and stay safe.

I started my morning with the 7th graders of St. Patrick School from Washington who collected over $3k in baby food and formula to support family support agencies in the area! I admire the hard work of these students to support a cause that we share a lot of passion for.

The politically motivated indictment of President Trump is an unprecedented move that should not be taken lightly. A left-wing prosecutor who routinely lets violent criminals free targeted a political opponent with flimsy legal theory rejected by the USDOJ.

As a former federal prosecutor, I believe the actions of this DA are an affront to our justice system.

I am proud to support HR 1: Lower Energy Costs Act. HR 1 prioritizes the energy needs of the American people over the Biden Administration’s radical energy and climate agenda. Today, @HouseGOP is keeping our promise lower energy costs and restore our energy independence.

Appreciated visiting with to Anne Builta Crider, Head if Wool Counsel for the American Sheep Industry and a sheep farmer from Arrowsmith, Illinois. We had a great discussion about trade, food safety, and issues impacting McLean County and Illinois farmers.

At today’s @WaysandMeansGOP hearing with the HHS Secretary, I pressed him on failures by CMS to properly implement my legislation to support hospital-based nursing programs and reduce barriers to access to FDA approved Alzheimer’s drugs rural communities that I represent.

Thank you to Michele Pankow, Chief of the Rockford Fire Department, for stopping by during her visit to DC. Since 1992, Michele has served Rockford and I appreciate all she and the Rockford Fire Department do to keep the community safe.

I joined @RepMikeQuigley today to introduce the Classified Documents Accountability Act to implement stronger enforcement for mishandling of classified documents. Classified documents must be handled in the appropriate manner and our bill with help protect our national security.

The Biden Admin’s lack of a substantive trade agenda is deeply troubling and we are missing opportunities to use trade as an offensive tool to strengthen our economy. At our @WaysandMeansGOP hearing, I pressed USTR on their trade agenda in the Indo-Pacific region and ceding economic leadership to China.

Joining my colleagues on the @WaysandMeansGOP this morning for a hearing with the U.S Trade Ambassador on America’s trade priorities.

FISA & Section 702 are important tools to protect our nation security, but violations of the civil liberties of Americans are unacceptable. I joined @jaketapper on @TheLeadCNN to discuss our work on the @HouseIntel FISA Working Group to provide needed reform.

I had a great tour of the Morris YMCA with their leadership team and enjoyed seeing their plans to expand the facility. The YMCA is an important resource for Grundy County residents and their partnership with Morris Hospital & Healthcare Centers is valued by all in the community.

Thank you to the Kendall-Grundy Farm Bureau for hosting me during lunch today! Ag is the #1 industry in Illinois, and I will continue to advocate for the Ag community on the Ways and Means Committee and in upcoming Farm Bill negotiations.

I started my day off in Morris at the LyondellBasell plant, meeting their team and taking a tour. LyondellBasell generates hundreds of jobs in Grundy County and we are grateful for their investment in central Illinois.

Stopped by Sorce Freshwater in East Peoria to tour their facility and discuss issues around Asian Carp. The Illinois River is an important resource for our region and we must work to protect it. I appreciate the work Sorce Freshwater and fishermen do in our community.

I had a great visit and this morning at the @FerreroNACorp plant in McLean County. Ferrero continues to make high-quality chocolate and products right here in Illinois. I appreciate all they do to support jobs and economic opportunities in central Illinois.

I voted this week to declassify information on the origins of COVID-19. 

The COVID-19 pandemic impacted every American family, and they deserve answers about how the pandemic started, where the virus came from, and the lab in Wuhan.

The Biden Administration is surrendering in global tax negotiations and it threatens American workers and businesses. At our @WaysandMeansGOP hearing with Secretary Yellen, I pressed the Secretary on the negative effects of the Biden Admin's tax policies and global DSTs.

This week, I voted to block the Biden Administration's overreaching WOTUS rule. The WOTUS rule puts an unnecessary burden on family farmers and rural communities in Illinois. We must work to provide certainty for our agriculture producers.

The FBI’s inappropriate querying of a duly elected Member of Congress is an egregious violation that undermines trust in our system and FISA. I joined @DanaPerino on @AmericaNewsroom to discuss our work on @HouseIntel to reform FISA & Section 702 to restore faith in this process.

Joining my colleagues on @WaysandMeansGOP to question Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen on the Biden Administration’s budget and tax hikes that would harm working families.

I pressed IC officials at the @HouseIntel hearing today on FISA and Section 702.

FISA is an important national security tool, but Americans have lost faith because of abuses by the FBI and IC.

We will work to reform FISA to ensure the civil liberties of Americans are protected.

I questioned FBI Director Wray today about Section 702 and FISA abuses. Reauthorization if Section 702 without reform is a nonstarter. As Chair of @HouseIntel’s FISA Working Group, I am committed to achieving meaningful reform that ensures we protect civil liberties and our national security.

The FBI’s inappropriate querying of a duly elected Member of Congress is an egregious violation that not only degrades trust in FISA and the Intelligence Community but is a threat to the foundational values of our democracy.

Enjoyed spending time with VFW officials from Illinois. Our veteran community deserves nothing but the best when they return home. In Congress, I’ll continue to work with the VFW and vets throughout #IL16 to ensure those who served our country get the support they need.

Thanks to the @ILFarmBureau for stopping by during their visit to DC. I appreciate all they do to advocate for Illinois farmers. In this Congress, we will push for a Farm Bill that protects Illinois agriculture, work to expand trade opportunities & bolster our lock & dam system.

From DC to Chicago, and across the country, soft-on-crime politicians and prosecutors are failing to protect our communities. @HouseGOP is working to back the police, reduce and deter violent crime, and hold soft-on-crime politicians accountable.

Illinois has a rich history of sound leadership and service to our country. The @DirksenCenter in Pekin is the leading research org to understand Illinois’ role in American and Congressional history. They continue to carry on Everett Dirksen’s legacy of servant leadership.

For over a year, @WaysandMeansGOP and IL members pushed for the Biden Admin to address Mexico’s import ban on GMO corn. Seeking formal talks is a good first step, but more must be done. I will continue to advocate for sound trade policy that benefits IL ag.farmweeknow.com/policy/natio…

Grateful to the staff at the John Evans Supportive Living Facility in Pekin for inviting me to visit their facility yesterday. I met with residents in the community and learned about the programs offered. Thanks for all you do in the community!

This morning, I visited and toured Alto Ethanol in Pekin. Ethanol is a vital part of Illinois’ ag economy. Whether it’s defending the RFS or working to increase market access, I will continue to advocate for our ag community on the Ways and Means Committee and in Congress.

Last week, I met with Jenny Thompson from the City of Rochelle and leaders from the Illinois Municipal Electric Agency. We had a good discussion about ongoing energy challenges facing Illinois, supply chain issues, and cybersecurity initiatives. Thanks for stopping by!
Enjoyed a visit with State Senator Dave Syverson in Rockford this week. Dave does an incredible job representing Northern Illinois and our region in Springfield!

Goodwill of Northern Illinois does incredible work to support those in need in the Rockford region. In DC this week, I met President Ben Bernstein and Courtney Greiger to discuss the programs they provide in Northern Illinois.
Had a great visit with City of Bloomington officials this week to discuss economic development in Bloomington and McLean County. Thanks for stopping by!

Closed out the day with a productive meeting with Therese Thill of the Rockford Area Economic Development Council! Rockford’s economy is a crucial part of #IL16. On the Ways & Means Committee, I will continue to advocate for pro-growth policies that allow small biz to thrive.

Today would’ve been Rep. Bob Michel’s 100th birthday, a proud son of Peoria and the longest serving GOP Leader in the House. From storming the beaches at Normandy to his time in Congress, Bob served our nation with honor, always remembering his Peoria roots. Happy birthday, Bob!

Great to be at the Northern Illinois Food Bank today in Rockford to visit their facility and learn about their programs, which serve over 250,000 meals per day. Thanks for all the Northern Illinois Food Bank does in our region! #IL16

Started the day off in the Village of Peoria Heights with Mayor Phelan to highlight funding our office helped secure to support improvements along Prospect Road. These improvements will enhance access, improve public safety, and bolster economic development in Peoria Heights.

Met with @ILSoybean during their trip to DC today. Illinois is our nation’s leader in soybean production and I am proud to represent one of the largest soy producing districts in the country. We had a good discussion about our trade agenda and upcoming Farm Bill negotiations.

The Chinese Communist Party works daily to undermine our economic and national security. On the @committeeonccp, we will work to investigate and expose the threat posed by the CCP, review our trade priorities in the Indo-Pacific, and bolster our supply chains.

China presents growing strategic challenges to our economic and national security. Tonight, I am joining my colleagues on the House Select Committee on the Chinese Communist Party for our first hearing on the threats the CCP poses to the United States: piped.video/live/gIbV7FIYwQA…

Today, at @WaysandMeansGOP, we are working to rein in rampant COVID-19 Unemployment Insurance fraud. Foreign bad actors and criminal organizations exploited this system to the tune of $400 billion. The American people deserve answers.

At the Peoria Civic Center today for the  Bradley vs. Drake game.  A game that will decide the regular-season championship for the Missouri Valley Conference.  Let’s Go @BradleyBraves!!!

Agriculture remains the top industry in Illinois and we have some of the most fertile farmland on the planet. FFA continues to lead the way in preparing our next generation of farmers and I am grateful for their work educate youth in #IL16.

Today, we honor presidents who helped shape America into the greatest country on Earth. From Washington to Lincoln and beyond, we celebrate the leaders who forged a better nation grounded in freedom and led our country in the highest office in the land. Happy Presidents' Day!

Thank you to East Peoria Mayor John Kahl for inviting me to speak to the Mayor’s Association this week. Being a Mayor is a tough job, but central Illinois is in good hands with these strong leaders and advocates for our towns and cities!

In Rockford, I enjoyed meeting with the Northwest Alliance of Realtors who support realtors across northern Illinois. We had a good discussion about the challenges inflation and the current economy present realtors, the importance of encouraging homeownership, and tax policy.

Thank you to President Howard Spearman and his team at Rock Valley Community College for the briefing and tour today in Rockford! I appreciate their leadership and work in helping to prepare students for the workforce through education and apprenticeship programs.
Thank you to Fire Chief Gary Bird for showing me around the Streator Fire Department! I will always support our first responders and I am grateful for the sacrifices they make everyday to protect us.

I visited the Helping Hands Resale Shoppe today in Chillicothe to hear about their mission as a faith-based organization that helps local charities. I am grateful for all they do supporting great causes in the community! Congrats to Brent Ressler and his entire team.

Started my day in Peoria touring the new VirtuSense facility. VirtuSense’s medical AI advancements support a more effective and efficient environment for healthcare improvements. It’s great to have VirtuSense’s innovative work right here in central Illinois.

In Bloomington-Normal, I toured the new YMCA facility. Thanks to BJ Wilken and their team for hosting me, and congrats on the new facility! I appreciate all that the YMCA and Easterseals do to support youth in central Illinois.

Started the day with a visit Cornerstone Christian Academy in Bloomington to talk to seniors who reached out to our office. They asked some great questions about current affairs and our work in Congress. The future will be in good hands with leaders like these students.

“I’m for freedom. He’s for government control.”

The contrast could not be clearer between President Biden’s speech and Governor @SarahHuckabe’s response. Our Republican agenda is built on freedom, opportunity, and nation where strong families thrive in safe communities.

Tonight we heard much of the same failed policies and rhetoric that we've witnessed over the past two years. Instead of shifting blame, President Biden should work to find commonsense solutions with Republicans to reduce costs, curb inflation, secure our border, and reduce crime.
I agree that we can and should work in a bipartisan way on issues including combating growing threats from China and the increasing harm fentanyl and opioids are doing to our communities.
That's why the American people elected a Republican House Majority to address these kitchen table issues, rein in out-of-control spending, and place a check on the Biden Administration.

Illinoisans are feeling the pain of two years under President Biden and one-party Democrat rule in Washington, with forty-year high inflation, skyrocketing energy costs, a fentanyl crisis from an overrun southern border, and rising violent crime.
We have a crisis at our southern border and fentanyl is flowing into our country. It’s time for President Biden to get serious about border security.

Under two years of President Biden, reckless spending has cause inflation and costs of everyday goods to soar. Our @HouseGOP majority will put a check on the Biden Administration and put our country on a fiscally sustainable path.

Under two years of President Biden and Democrat leadership in Washington, our country has been harmed by forty-year high inflation, skyrocketing energy costs, a fentanyl crisis from an overrun southern border, and rising violent crime. #SOTU

I’m honored to be appointed by @SpeakerMcCarthy to the Select Committee on China and continue my work on the Intelligence Committee. Now more than ever, Congress must work to strengthen our economic and national security and address the generational challenges posed by China.

Thank you to Ingersoll Machine Tools for showing us around their facility in Rockford this week. Illinois manufacturers are leading the way in innovation. On the Ways & Means Committee, I’ll continue to support pro-growth policies that keep manufacturing jobs in our state.

Enjoyed visiting @FlyRFD and the Greater Rockford Airport Authority this morning to discuss priorities for the airport, transportation in northern Illinois, and the importance of RFD as an economic driver for our region. Thanks to Mike Dunn and his staff for the tour.

I join with Americans in Washington, D.C. and across the country today in standing up for the unborn and defending the inherent right to life. I will always lend a voice to the voiceless in Congress. #ProLife

Thank you to Adam Dontz for inviting me to speak at the Greater Livingston County Economic Development Council’s annual meeting in Pontiac. I will continue to be an advocate for economic development and a stronger business climate that attracts opportunities to our region. #IL16

Had great visits today with the LaSalle and Livingston County Farm Bureau’s discussing the upcoming Farm Bill, trade, biofuels, and tax policy. I will continue to ensure that our ag producers in #IL16 have a seat at the table as we begin important discussions on the Farm Bill.

Today I visited Illinois Valley Community College to meet with President Dr. Jerry Corcoran to discuss their programs, workforce training opportunities, and education. It was great to tour the Ag Education Center, which will train the future generation of Illinois farmers.

Thank you to Putnam County Superintendent Dr. Clayton Theisinger for hosting me at Putnam County Primary School and showing me around. It was great to hear about the future plans for the school and how they plan to boost enrollment and keep students engaged!

Enjoyed touring the @Rivian plant in Bloomington and test driving the new vehicles being manufactured in Illinois! The innovative work Rivian is doing is second to none, and I appreciate their continued commitment to economic development in central Illinois.

Enjoyed visiting with Goodwill of Central Illinois today in Peoria to discuss the services they provide for veterans and those in need. Thanks to CEO Don Johnson, Johanna Wagner, and Lori Johnson for all the work they do in our community.

Thanks to the Bureau County Farm Bureau for having me to discuss the new Congress! Ag is the #1 industry in Illinois, and I will continue to advocate for our farmers, ethanol producers, and ag community on the Ways and Means Committee.
￼As we reflect on the life and legacy of Martin Luther King, Jr. today, may we remember his enduring commitment to peace, equality, and justice for all.
Thank you to the Peoria Rotary for having me this afternoon to discuss a busy week in Washington and our priorities for the 118th Congress! #IL16

I spoke to the Greater Peoria Contractors and Suppliers Association about our priorities for the new Congress. GPCSA was founded in Peoria and their members work to boost local economic development. Thank you to Carla Jockisch, Andy Volz, and Michael Williams for the invitation.

Energy security is vital to our national and economic security. That’s why I voted in favor of the Protecting America’s Strategic Petroleum Reserve from China Act today. The bill ends oil sales from our Strategic Petroleum Reserve to China.

President Biden’s potential mishandling of classified information raises serious questions about the safeguarding of highly sensitive materials. Our House Republican majority will provide necessary oversight of Biden’s handling of classified documents.
Enjoyed visiting with Logan Gastman from Roanoke during his trip to DC as part of the Academy at the National Automobile Dealer Association. #IL16
I want to congratulate and welcome the new members of @WaysandMeansGOP. I am excited to work with them under Chairman @RepJasonSmith’s leadership to fulfill our Commitment to America.

I voted in favor of legislation to condemn recent attacks on pro-life facilities, groups, and churches and the Born-Alive Abortion Survivors Protection Act. I am proud to be Pro-Life, and I will continue to stand up and lend a voice to the voiceless in Congress.

I am continuing to monitor the fire at the Carus Chemical plant in LaSalle County. I am grateful to the first responders who acted quickly and thankful that no one was injured. Residents should continue to monitor updates from the local authorities. wgntv.com/news/emergency-cre…

China presents growing national security and economic challenges to the United States. Now more than ever, Congress must work to strengthen our competitiveness. As a GOP China Task Force Member, I strongly support the creation of a Select Committee on China by @SpeakerMcCarthy.

Families and small businesses in central and northwestern Illinois need their tax returns processed and phone calls answered, not more IRS agents knocking on their doors with costly, unnecessary, and burdensome audits.

Democrats in Illinois voted to give lawmakers a 16% raise during the lame-duck session. As inflation soars and Illinois pension debt hits $139.7 billion, the last thing the state legislature should spend taxpayer money on is raises for lawmakers. shawlocal.com/news/2023/01/0…

On Law Enforcement Appreciation Day, we thank the men and women who protect and serve our communities. Today, and everyday, I am grateful to those who are willing to put their lives on the line to keep us safe.
Under Speaker Kevin McCarthy's leadership, House Republicans will hit the ground running to deliver for the American people.

I am pleased that our Republican Conference unified behind Kevin McCarthy. The American people elected a GOP majority to place a check on the Biden Administration, address out-of-control inflation and rising costs, secure our southern Border, and restore our energy independence.

On the Ways and Means Committee and the Intelligence Committee, I will work to advance policies that prioritize Illinois, get our economy back on track, expand trade markets, support agriculture, increase rural health access, and protect our national security interests.

Over the past 7 years, it has been a privilege to represent central and west-central Illinois. I look forward to serving central and northwestern Illinois, continuing my commitment to high-quality constituent service and preserving our conservative, Midwestern values.
I am humbled and honored to be sworn in as the new United States Representative for the 16th Congressional District of Illinois. #IL16 lahood.house.gov/2023/1/laho…
Congratulations to the next Speaker of the House, Kevin McCarthy! @GOPLeader and @HouseGOP are ready to get to work.

Americans voted for a Republican majority to put a check on the Biden Administration, secure our Southern Border, and address inflation. Let’s come together as Republicans so we focus on the challenges that Americans sent us to Washington to fix. wgnradio.com/john-williams/r…

Today marks the end of one-party Democrat control of Washington, with a new @HouseGOP majority. As we start the 118th Congress, I am honored to begin serving the 16th District of Illinois. I look forward to getting to work to represent central and northwestern Illinois! #IL16
Happy New Year! I hope your 2023 is blessed with happiness and good health. 🎉
